entry.title: Non-confiscatory Transaction Weight Limit
entry.summary: The inquiry raises a significant point about the feasibility of protocols that require large transactions to negotiate directly with miners for storage solutions within their coinbases. This approach, if viable, would circumvent the limitations posed by the proposal in question, rendering its impact negligible. The essence of the query lies in exploring alternative mechanisms for transaction or data storage that bypass conventional constraints, potentially offering a more efficient pathway for protocols burdened by the need for substantial transaction sizes. This dialogue opens up a broader discussion on the adaptability and flexibility of blockchain infrastructure, specifically regarding how it can accommodate the evolving needs of various protocols without compromising on efficiency or security. The proposition also hints at the ongoing negotiation between technological limitations and innovative problem-solving within the blockchain community, emphasizing the importance of finding creative solutions to technical challenges.
